projects.name: Modular Thermal Camera
projects.short: Working at Tonbo Imaging, a camera company. My work here is to bring up the Qualcomm Snapdragon platform at the application layer, creating a base for camera-client communication, the client SDK and camera FDK, a base for vision problems, streaming, and fast image operations such as false coloring and video stabilization.

projects.name: Auto Quad
projects.short: The idea is to buy a cheap chinese quad and eliminate drift + stabilize + direct it using a camera placed on top.

projects.name: Mass Whatsapp Forwarder

projects.name: Lib Graf
projects.short: A library to take a continuous media source [camera, video, gstreamer byte arrays], apply OpenGL filters [vertex+fragment shaders], and configure rendering in shape, size and rotation in 3D space the input and direct to any/multiple Surfaces on Android.

projects.name: Lifehacks

projects.name: Portfolio
projects.short: Recursive; My personal space in the great world wide web. I've revised the design time and again, and feel I'm at a stage where I'm quite happy with it now!

projects.name: Request For Change
projects.short: change.org but with my university's requirements in mind hosted internally.

projects.name: Analytics with Flask
projects.short: An analytics tool for my personal Android projects. I re-invented the wheel with this one.
projects.description: I re-invented the wheel with this one. But I'm glad I did as I learnt a whole lot. Basically made Google Analytics for apps using Python Flask and a local database which pushes new information every time it receives a net connection. What my roomate and I created is a tool to save data on the app locally as JSON until it can be pushed to the online database. We used this to track users using DAWebmail, keeping a tab of how often the app is used, viewing user actions- how many webmails are read on the app, how often webmails are deleted from the app, and so on. I later used this at MIT Kumbathon to track how often people call the ambulance/hospital during the Kumbhmela.

projects.name: Social ties from Spatio-Temporal Dataset
projects.short: An analytics tool for my personal Android projects. I re-invented the wheel with this one.

projects.name: Lego Truck
projects.short: A Lego Truck made with monster wheels we bought at a store in Singapore.
projects.description: This was a time when I wanted to make really big cars - and so when we were in Singapore I went gaga at how many Lego stores there were all over the city. We bought these monster truck tires that I later used in several creations.

projects.name: Lego Rail Climber
projects.short: A Lego rail climber; it could go up and down our bunk bed's slide.
projects.description: I don't remember if I actually did anything useful with this, but the idea was to be able to send things to my brother using our bunk bed's slide.

projects.name: Lego Monster Car
projects.short: A Lego monster car using chains.
projects.description: I used the super huge wheels from the truck I made before this, and used chains between the motor and the tires.

projects.name: Lego Crane
projects.short: A Lego Crane that could hold upto 250 grams.
projects.description: This was one of the first creations I had to struggle with quite a bit to get right. It took a couple revisions of taking apart and rebuilding before I could make an actually useable crane.

projects.name: Lego Color Sorter
projects.short: A Lego Color Sorter. My idea was to later be able to sort my other oldschool bricks according to their colors.
